reporting.title: Incident & Irregularity Reporting
reporting.intro: Use this page to understand how to submit credible, structured reports about election-related incidents. Provide factual, time-bound, location-specific details.
reporting.li1: Be objective: avoid speculation, focus on observed facts.
reporting.li2: Preserve evidence: do not alter media or documents.
reporting.li3: Protect identities where safety risks exist.
reporting.scopeText: Covers polling process issues, intimidation, procedural violations, ballot handling anomalies, accessibility barriers and systemic irregularities. Non-election personal disputes are out of scope.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions and answers about the election investigation process.

q1.question: What is the purpose of this commission?
q1.answer: The commission is formed to collect experiences and views about the elections of 2014, 2018, and 2024. We aim to gather public opinions and incident reports to build future recommendations for improving the electoral process.

q2.question: How can I submit my opinion or report?
q2.answer: You can submit your opinion through our interactive online form, verified email channels, or designated phone lines. Please keep your inputs concise, evidence-oriented, and respectful.

q3.question: Is my information kept confidential?
q3.answer: Yes, we follow strict legal and ethical guidelines to protect your privacy. Please avoid sharing sensitive personal data, and we will handle all submissions according to our privacy policy.

q4.question: What types of incidents should I report?
q4.answer: You can report polling process issues, intimidation, procedural violations, ballot handling anomalies, accessibility barriers, and systemic irregularities. Personal disputes unrelated to elections are outside our scope.

q5.question: How will my submission be used?
q5.answer: Your submissions will be analyzed to identify patterns and issues in the electoral process. The findings will contribute to recommendations for future electoral reforms and improvements.
